column16: Lythrum portula is a ANNUAL growing to 0.2 m (0ft 8in) by 0.3 m (1ft).  It is in flower from June to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs).  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  wet soil and can grow in water.
